<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="originating-summons">ORIGINATING SUMMONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#originating-summons" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>(Under Order 37, Rule 3 of the Civil Procedure Rules, 2010)</p>
<p>Let SAM and SUSAN WA of P.O. Box 111 Nairobi in the Republic of Kenya within FIFTEEN (15) DAYS after service of this Summons on them inclusive of the day such service cause an appearance to be entered upon the application of above named STE, BENJAMIN A and whose address for service for the purposes of this suit is care of M/S OC ...00100 NAIROBI on an application for to determine the following QUESTIONS:</p>
<ol>
<li>Is there any interest due to the Vendors on account of the transaction for the sale of LR No. 2259/679 (Original Number 2259/171/3), Nairobi?</li>
<li>Was a completion notice served in accordance with the terms of the Sale Agreement dated 12th July 2011?</li>
<li>If 1 is in the affirmative, what is the interest amount due?</li>
<li>Were the Purchasers Advocates obliged to issue a completion notice before charging interest on the balance of the purchase price?</li>
<li>What was the rate of interest applicable at the different material times when interest was being accrued?</li>
<li>Who should bear the costs of this application?</li>
</ol>
<p>The Application is supported by the annexed affidavit of nnn together with other grounds to be adduced at the hearing.</p>

<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>
<p>The Applicants were the purchasers while the Respondents were the vendors in respect of a purchase transaction for LR No. 2259/679 (original Number 2259/171/3) Nairobi and pursuant to which the parties entered into a sale agreement dated 12th July 2011 (hereafter 'the Agreement'). A copy of the Agreement is annexed at page ... of the bundle of documents marked RO.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Vendors instructed the firm of Ms. Ka &amp; Company Advocates (hereafter the Vendors Advocates) while the Purchasers retained the firm of Ms. Miller &amp; Company Advocates (hereafter the Purchasers Advocates) to represent them in the transaction.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Purchasers on their part were to be co-financed by Citibank and Kenya Commercial Bank Ltd represented in the transaction by the firms of nnnnno &amp; Company Advocates respectively.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The parties further on the 17th of November 2011 entered into an Addendum to the Agreement whereat one kkky was added to the Agreement as a Purchaser to the Agreement. A copy of the Addendum is annexed at page ... of the bundle of documents.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The purchase price for the sale was the sum of Kshs. 36,000,000/- payable in three tranches as detailed under Clause 3.1 of the Agreement. In accordance with Clause 3.1 (a) of the Agreement the sum of Kshs. 500,000/- was duly released to the Vendors Advocates on 7th July 2011. A copy of the acknowledgement is annexed at page ... of the bundle of documents.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A copy of the rectified Certificate of Title was availed to the Purchaser's Advocates on 18th August 2011 after which the Purchaser's Advocates applied for an official search at the Lands Office necessary to verify the authenticity of the rectified Certificate of Title and which action was on 22nd August 2011 communicated to the Vendor's Advocates. A copy of the letter from the Vendors Advocates dated 18th August 2011 and that dated 22nd August 2011 from the Purchaser's Advocates are annexed at pages ... and... respectively of the bundle of documents.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Official Search applied for by the Purchaser's Advocates was however delayed as the Deed File was not available. This development was duly communicated to the Vendor's Advocates on the 25th August 2011. A copy of the letter dated 25th August 2011 is annexed at page ... of the bundle of documents.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Purchaser's Advocates did obtain the Official Search on 1st September 2011 and on the 2nd of September 2011 the further deposit of Kshs. 3,100,000/- was duly transferred into the Vendor's Advocates bank account by Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS). An extract copy of the RTGS is annexed at page ... of the bundle of documents.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Agreement further provided under Clause 7.1 (c) that the Vendors were to give the Purchasers a Twenty One (21) day notice in writing to remedy a breach failure to which the Vendors would be entitled to charge.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>At no time did the Vendors give the completion notice for the Purchasers to remedy the breach in respect of delay of the purchase price.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The Purchaser's Advocates, without prejudice to the foregoing, delayed by a period of 15 days in releasing the balance of the 10% deposit being the sum of Kshs. 3,100,000/- which delay attracted interest at the then prevailing base lending rate for Barclays Bank of Kenya in accordance with Clause 1.1 as read with Clause 9 of the Agreement. The interest accrued thereon would be Kshs. 19,057.38 being:</p>
</li>

<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="inter-pleader-proceedings">INTER PLEADER PROCEEDINGS:<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#inter-pleader-proceedings" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>One makes an application for inter pleader proceedings by way of Originating Summons.</li>
<li>The Applicant for inter pleader proceedings must be a neutral party with no claim or interest whatsoever, to the subject matter.</li>
<li>They must be making the application, for the sole purpose of protecting themselves from damages as a result of their action in relation to either of the two claimants.</li>
<li>The Applicant must not be in collusion with either of the parties and the claimant must be willing and ready to deal with the subject matter in whatever manner the court directs.</li>
<li>The Application is made by way of O.S.</li>
<li>We cite the enabling section of the law in every O.S. and C.S because the court has to straight away know that it is allowed by the statutes.</li>
<li>Order 34 sub rule 2 Where one applies for inter pleader proceedings he must first satisfy the court that:</li>
<li>i) He claims no interest in the subject matter in dispute other than for charges or for costs.</li>
<li>ii) There's no collusion between him and any of the parties.</li>
<li>iii) He is willing to pay or transfer into the court the subject matter or to dispose it as the court may order.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="additional-notes">ADDITIONAL NOTES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#additional-notes" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>Interpleader refers to a type of action in which several different parties claim ownership to a fund or property that is in the control of another. It is an important way of bringing persons into a suit.</li>
<li>X is in possession of property that is being claimed by more than 1 party. He has no interest in it apart from charges for bringing the action. E.g. A is holding property and B and C are both claiming this property but are not going to court to have their rights determined. Therefore A goes to court to determine whose property that is. A therefore wants the two to plead against each other hence interpleader proceedings. It is brought for purposes of interpleading between the adverse claimants.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-58-of-civil-procedure-act-order-34">Section 58 of Civil Procedure Act Order 34<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-58-of-civil-procedure-act-order-34" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="essence-of-an-interpleader">Essence of an Interpleader<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#essence-of-an-interpleader" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ul>
<li>To safeguard the person holding the property to avoid subsequent court proceedings against the property.</li>
</ul>
<ol>
<li>When a buyer B has bought land from V the vendor. The advocate is acting for both of them. A will therefore hold the purchase price as a stakeholder. In the process V finds</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>another buyer and wants to change his mind and wants the money from A again. What happens? This is where an interpleader come in as both of them think they have the right to the purchase price. The advocate A will go to court and have the parties interpleaded.</p>
<p>A court broker goes to Kamau the JD and attaches his property and Mrs. Kamau the wife says that the property they have it is her who acquired it. To determine</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>who's property it is you have them interplead especially after the property has been attached and sold and the parties are claiming the proceeds.</li>
<li>Also comes up in insurance where the insurance is ready and willing to pay money and two of your husbands come up and claim that they own the car. It has to be determined who actually owns the car. The insurance company will come up with an interpleader suit to determine the real owner of the cars.</li>
<li>Also in cases of compulsory land acquisition. The government may be ready to pay but does not know who to pay as many owners come up. They will therefore be interpleaded.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>The right parties to be interpleaded are the rival claimants. Both of them will become the respondents.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="how-do-you-commence-such-suits">How do you commence such suits?<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#how-do-you-commence-such-suits" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-58-o-34">Section 58, O.34<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-58-o-34" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>That where no suit is pending and you want to commence interpleader suits you bring them by Originating Summons. Where there is a pending suit against the person holding the property (A) you will come by way of Summons (Interlocutory).</li>
<li>Where there is a pending suit but which is not necessarily against the person holding the property (A) you utilize Section 58 and bring the suit by way of Notice of Motion.</li>
<li>Order 34 clashes against Section 58 so Section 58 overrides.</li>
<li>The whole process of interpleader can be divided into two:</li>
</ul>
<ol>
<li>When the applicant is trying to justify the application i.e. is this the right case to interplead.</li>
<li>When the claimants are now being interpleaded.</li>
</ol>
<p>NOTE: We cite the enabling section of the law in every O.S. and C.S because the court has to straight away know that it is allowed by the statutes.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ul>
<li>The applicant wants to be relieved from the controversy. You must show certain conditions which must be satisfied which are set out in Section 58 and Order 34 Rule 2 e.g.</li>
</ul>
<p>a) Must show that you don't have an interest in the subject matter of the dispute.
b) Have not colluded with any of the claimants.
c) Are willing to deliver the property to the right person if the matter is determined.
d) Must show that you are in possession of that property.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="sargent-vs-gaulama-1968-ea-338">Sargent vs. Gaulama (1968) EA 338<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#sargent-vs-gaulama-1968-ea-338" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The three conditions were set out in this case. Also "Judicial Hints of Civil Procedure 1984 Ed Pg 222-223 or Reprint 212-213). The adverse claims must be genuine and what you really want are your charges and costs. Also make sure you make the application on time and served upon the claimants who must then file Affidavits of Claims which set out the claims precisely though give sufficient details as they shall be what the court will use to make its determination. This application stays other pending suits.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="what-orders-can-the-court-make">What orders can the court make?<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#what-orders-can-the-court-make" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The court has wide powers it can make on this application e.g.</p>
<p>a) Dismiss the application if you do not satisfy the grounds.
b) If the claimants don't attend court, then the court will dismiss the claims and make orders that the claimants forever keep their peace. (barred for good against making claims against the holder of the property).
c) If the claimants appear, the court can have a summary dismissal of the matter without having to hear evidence if only the parties agree.
d) Court can transfer the proceedings to the Magistrates Court as long as the matter is within the jurisdiction of the magistrate's court.
e) The High Court may order that the proceedings be transferred to be dealt with under the arbitration process.
f) Refer the matter for examination of accounts to an appointed referee.
g) Order substitution or addition of a claimant. Where there is suit against the applicant but the court finds that the suit is really 1.1 the claimants, it can drop out A so that B is now made the defendant in place of the advocate, so that it is against B and C.
h) Order that an issue 1.1. The claimants be stated, framed and tried.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="an-interpleder-proceeding-will-normally-contain">AN INTERPLEDER PROCEEDING WILL NORMALLY CONTAIN<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#an-interpleder-proceeding-will-normally-contain" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

<p><strong>EXERCISE</strong></p>
<p><strong>STATEMENT OF FACTS</strong></p>
<p>XYZ Car Dealers Ltd deal in motor vehicle. Mr. Stanley Omwoyo has dealt with the dealers for seven years now.</p>
<p>On 2nd February 2013, he goes to the dealers and obtains a vehicle, Toyota Land Cruiser Registration No. KCD 923 X under a hire purchase agreement. The vehicle is valued at Kshs. 15,000,000. Due to their long and friendly business relationship, he manages to persuade the dealer to hand over the log book to him for unclear reasons.</p>
<p>Once he obtains the log book, he rushes to ABC bank, Embu and obtains a loan of Kshs. 5,000,000 and registers a Chattels Mortgage against the vehicle. This is fairly easy for him as the vehicle was registered in the name of “Stanley Omwoyo Steve” who happens to be the managing Director of the Dealer. Mr Omwoyo merely swore an affidavit indicating that he was the bearer of that name. He successfully clears the loan repayment and the bank is on the verge of discharging the log book.</p>
<p>Just before it does, XYZ Dealers Ltd gets wind of the loan that Mr. Omwoyo obtained under security of their vehicle. He has defaulted in paying the last instalment. The dealers write to the</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>bank notifying the bank of the fraud and demanding that the log book be released to themselves as the rightful owners. They threaten to sue the bank for conversion if it releases the documents to Mr. Omwoyo.</p>
<p>ABC Bank is caught up in a dilemma and approaches court by interpleader proceedings seeking to have the court determine the rightful owner of the vehicle.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="republic-of-kenya">REPUBLIC OF KENYA<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#republic-of-kenya" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="in-the-chief-magistrate-s-court-at-embu">IN THE CHIEF MAGISTRATE'S COURT AT EMBU<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#in-the-chief-magistrate-s-court-at-embu" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>CIVIL SUIT NO. OF 2016</p>
<p>ABC BANK LIMITED...INTERPLEADER APPLICANT</p>
<p>-VERSUS-</p>
<p>STANLEY OMWOYO...1ST RESPONDENT</p>
<p>XYZ CAR DEALERS LIMITED...2ND RESPONDENT</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="originating-summons">ORIGINATING SUMMONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#originating-summons" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>(Under Order 34 Rules 1, 2, 5 and 7 and all enabling provisions of the Law)</p>
<p>Let Stanley Omwoyo of P.O Box 2345, Embu and XYZ Car Dealers Ltd of P.O Box 907, Nairobi within ... days after service of this summons on him, inclusive of the day of such service, cause an appearance to be entered for them to this summons, which is issued upon the Application of ABC Bank Ltd Of P.O Box 1315, Embu for orders that:</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT the court determines the true ownership of the vehicle Toyota Land Cruiser Registration Number KCD 923X (hereinafter “the vehicle”).</li>
<li>THAT the Applicant be allowed to discharge the chattels mortgage and release the vehicle to the court or as the court may direct.</li>
<li>THAT costs of this application be provided for.</li>
</ol>
<p>WHICH APPLICATION is supported by the annexed affidavit of ANITA MARY on the following grounds and other grounds to be adduced at the hearing hereof: -</p>
<p>(a) THAT both the 1st and 2nd Respondents claim legitimate title over the vehicle.
(b) That the Applicant is in possession of the log book to the vehicle by dint of a loan secured in favour of the 1st Respondent.
(c) That the 2nd Respondent has demanded that the log book be released to them as the lawful owners.
(d) THAT the loan has already been satisfactorily repaid and the Applicant intends to discharge the chattels mortgage and release the logbook but only to the legitimate owners in the interest of justice.
(e) THAT the Applicant has no interest in the vehicle.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>(f) THAT there is no collusion between the Applicant and any of the Respondents in filing this Application.</p>
<p>(g) THAT the Applicant is willing to transfer the log book to the court or deal with it in any manner as this court directs.</p>
<p>DATED at EMBU this day of 2016.</p>
<p>FIRMTWENTYFIVE &amp; COMPANY
ADVOCATES FOR THE APPLICANT</p>

<p>I, ANITA MARY of Post Office Box Number 1315, Embu in the Republic of Kenya make oath and state as follows: -</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>THAT I am an adult of sound mind and the Legal Officer of the Applicant bank duly authorised by the Applicant to depose in this affidavit and I am conversant with the matter herein.</p>

<p>THAT on 13th April, 2015, the Applicant advanced a loan of Kshs. 5,000,000/= to the 1st Respondent and registered a chattels mortgage upon Toyota Land Cruiser registration No. KCD 923 X and has since had possession of the log book for the vehicle in the name of “Stanley Omwoyo Steve”. Annexed and marked “ABC 1” is a copy of the chattels mortgage.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the 1st Respondent has successfully completed the loan repayments upon which the bank wishes to discharge the chattels mortgage.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the Applicant has received a demand notice from the 2nd Respondent demanding that the log book be released to them. Annexed herein and marked “ABC 2” is a copy of the demand letter.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the 2nd Respondent claims that “Stanley Omwoyo Steve” is its managing director and that the 1st Respondent fraudulently acquired the log book from them.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the Applicant is at crossroads as to whom to release the log book to and thereby seeks the intervention of this Honourable Court.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the Applicant has no interest whatsoever in the vehicle.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT there is no collusion between the Applicant and any of the Respondents in filing this Application.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT none of the parties herein will be prejudiced if this Application is granted.</p>
</li>

<p>(Under Section 58 of the Civil Procedure Act, Order 34 Rules (1), (2), (5) and (7) of the Civil Procedure Rules, 2010, Section 3A of the Civil Procedure Act and all other enabling provisions of law)</p>
<p>LET ALL PARTIES concerned attend to the Honourable Magistrate in the chambers on the
...day of ...2016 at 9.00 o'clock in the fore/afternoon or soon thereafter for
hearing of the counsel for the applicant for ORDERS:-</p>
<ol>
<li>That the Applicant be admitted to the ongoing proceedings as an Interpleader.</li>
<li>That the Applicant be allowed to discharge the chattels mortgage and release the vehicle to the court or as the court may direct.</li>
<li>That the costs of this Application be in the cause.</li>
</ol>
<p>WHICH APPLICATION is based on the following grounds : -</p>
<p>i. That the Applicant and the 1st Respondent entered into a loan agreement on the 13th day of April 2015.
ii. That the 1st Respondent charged the Motor Vehicle to the Applicant as security for that loan.
iii. That the 1st Respondent has since completely serviced that loan thereby prompting the Applicant to want to discharge the chattels mortgage.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>iv. That the Applicant is aware that the ownership of the motor vehicle is in contention before this court and is thus confused as to who is the rightful owner.</p>
<p>v. That the Applicant claims no interest in the subject matter in dispute.</p>
<p>vi. That the Applicant is willing to transfer the motor vehicle into court or to dispose of it as the court may direct.</p>
<p>vii. It is in the interest of justice that this application be allowed.</p>
<p>Which Application is further supported by the affidavit of Anita Mary and any other grounds that may be adduced at trial.</p>
<p>Dated at Embu this...day of...2016</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="supporting-affidavit">SUPPORTING AFFIDAVIT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#supporting-affidavit" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>I, Anita Mary of P.O Box 1315, Embu within the Republic of Kenya do hereby make oath and state as follows: -</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> I am an adult of sound mind and disposition and the Legal Officer for the Applicant herein hence competent to swear this affidavit.</p>
</li>

<p><strong>THAT</strong> the Applicant entered into a loan agreement with the 1st Respondent on the 13th day of April 2015.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> pursuant to that loan agreement, the 1st Respondent charged the motor vehicle (subject of these proceedings) to the Applicant. SEE COPY OF CHATTELS MORTGAGE ATTACHED AND MARKED AS ABC 1</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> the 1st Respondent has since completely serviced that loan and the interest that accrued thereon.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> before the Applicant could discharge the Chattels Mortgage, the 2nd Respondent served it with a demand notice by which the 2nd Respondent claims ownership of the Motor Vehicle and stopping discharge and release of the same to the 2nd Respondent. SEE COPY OF DEMAND NOTICE ATTACHED AND MARKED AS ABC 2.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> the 2nd Respondent claims that “Stanley Omwoyo Steve” is its managing director and that the 1st Respondent fraudulently acquired the log book from them.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>THAT</strong> the Applicant is desirous to discharge the Chattels Mortgage and release the motor vehicle to the rightful owner.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>

<ol start="8">

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="notice-of-motion">NOTICE OF MOTION<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#notice-of-motion" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>These are motions to institute substantive proceedings in which rights will be determined.</li>
<li>Anything not specified in the rules or statute (the way the application is not specified) then it is commenced by way of motion whether interlocutory or at the commencement of the original proceedings.</li>
<li>Look at Order 51. Where there are no pending suits in court – Miscellaneous applications. Also applied where there is express provision under any statute.</li>
<li>See in <em>Mansion House Ltd v Wilkinson 1954 Volume 21 EA CAR</em> – Order 51 is not limited to interlocutory applications but you can also commence suits under this Order through a Notice of Motion.</li>
<li>Examples of where a Notice of Motion is used.
a) Application for orders for Judgment on Admission;
b) Application of Summary Judgment;
c) Application of Stay of Proceedings;
d) Application for lifting of an injunction, variation or discharge of it;
e) Application for Release Orders e.g. Habeas Corpus Order.
f) When seeking judicial review at second stage, once you have sought leave to seek Judicial Review Order 53 Rule 3
g) Application to obtain a court’s approval for a settlement on behalf of a person who suffers from incapacity e.g. minors, unsound mind e.t.c.
h) When applying for one to be fined or imprisoned for contempt court proceedings. Contempt ex-versie curiae</li>
<li>The objective of a notice of motion is to provide an easy and speedy procedure for seeking a relief from the court.</li>
<li>Similar to an Originating Summons a Notice of Motion is entitled</li>
</ul>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF...(ISSUE)
IN THE MATTER OF...(STATUTE CONCERNED)</p>
<p>Must be clearly headed and state the remedies sought. State the order also.
The warnings at the bottom should also be put as it is done in originating summons.
The evidence is by affidavit which must be served on the opposing party.
The person signing is the applicant or his advocate who is preparing.
The grounds should be state generally.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ul>
<li>Example</li>
</ul>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF THE CHILDREN'S ACT
AND
IN THE MATTER OF AN APPLICATION FOR THE CUSTODY OF CHRISTINE OTIENO
BETWEEN
JOSEPH MOLAMEI...APPLICANT
VERSUS
SUSAN MOLAMEI...RESPONDENT</p>
<p>NOTICE OF MOTION
Have it properly signed and filed then serve the other parties.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="republic-of-kenya">REPUBLIC OF KENYA<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#republic-of-kenya" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

MISC. CIVIL APPLICATION NO. 792 OF 2004</p>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF THE ARBITRATION ACT 1995</p>
<p>AND</p>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF THE ARBITRATION RULES, 1997</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="versus">VERSUS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#versus" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

KATMAI INVESTMENTS LTD : 2nd RESPONDENT
CALUWA LIMITED : 3rd RESPONDENT
GIAN CARLO FERRARI : 4th RESPONDENT</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="notice-of-motion">NOTICE OF MOTION<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#notice-of-motion" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>(Under Section 3A of the Civil Procedure Act, Chapter 21 of the Laws of Kenya and all enabling provisions of the Law)</p>
<p>TAKE NOTICE that this Honourable Court shall be moved on the ______ day of ______ 2005 at 9.00 O'clock in the forenoon or so soon thereafter for the hearing of an application on the part of counsel for the Applicants for ORDERS:</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT this matter be certified as urgent and service thereof dispensed with owing to the urgency, nature and circumstances of the case.</li>
<li>THAT this Honourable Court be pleased to give an early hearing date for the hearing of the pending application dated 21st June 2004.</li>
<li>THAT this Honourable Court be pleased to issue such other or further orders as it may deem just and expedient in the circumstances.</li>
</ol>
<p>WHICH APPLICATION is supported by the affidavit of YUVINALIS ANGIMA and based on the following grounds:</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ol>
<li>The Applicants filed an application for recognition and enforcement of the Arbitral Award on 21st June 2004 which application has been taken out of the hearing list on two different occasions.</li>
<li>This matter was first scheduled for hearing on 20th September 2004 but it was not listed due to a mistake on the part of the court registry. The matter was next fixed for hearing on 15th January 2005 but again it was not listed.</li>
<li>That on 19th January 2005 the Applicants moved this honourable court under a certificate of urgency pursuant to which the said application was fixed for hearing on 3rd March 2005.</li>
<li>That when this matter was listed for hearing on 3rd March 2005 the same was taken out partly because the applicants' advocates had served a hearing notice for 23rd March 2005 due to a genuine and unintentional mistake on their part and partly because the court mistakenly thought that it was the Respondent's Notice of Motion dated 23rd August 2004 which had been wrongly listed before the due date.</li>
<li>The Respondents herein have taken advantage of this delay and they have in fact proceeded to wilfully disobey the Order of the Learned Arbitrator dated 14th April 2004.</li>
<li>The Respondent's wilful disobedience of the Arbitral Award herein is utterly detrimental to the Applicants for not only causing them intense frustration and crippling their operations but also threatening to cause a breach of the peace.</li>
<li>The affidavit of GIOVANNI GAIDA filed herein on 19th January 2005.</li>
</ol>
<p>Dated at Nairobi this ______________ day of ______________ 2005</p>
<p>RACHIER &amp; AMOLLO
ADVOCATES FOR THE APPLICANTS</p>
<p>DRAWN &amp; FILED BY:
RACHIER &amp; AMOLLO
ADVOCATES
REINSURANCE PLAZA, 7TH FLOOR
P O BOX 55645-00200
NAIROBI</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="certificate-of-urgency">CERTIFICATE OF URGENCY<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#certificate-of-urgency" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>I, YUVINALIS ANGIMA, an advocate of the High Court of Kenya practising as such in the firm of Rachier &amp; Amollo Advocates, do hereby certify that the application filed herewith is extremely urgent on the grounds that:</p>
<ol>
<li>The Learned Arbitrator Mrs ROA Otieno issued an Arbitral award dated 14th April 2004 in the matter of an Arbitration involving the parties herein.</li>
<li>The Applicants filed an application for recognition for enforcement of the Arbitral Award which application has been taken out of the hearing list on two different occasions.</li>
<li>The Respondents herein have taken advantage of this delay and they have in fact proceeded to wilfully disobey the Order of the Learned Arbitrator dated 14th April 2004.</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ol start="4">
<li>The Respondents' wilful disobedience of the Arbitral Award herein is utterly detrimental to the applicants for not only causing them intense frustration and crippling their operations but also threatens to cause a breach of the peace.</li>
</ol>

<p>AND</p>

<p>AND</p>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF AN ARBITRATION</p>

<p>GIOVANNI GAIDA &amp; 79 OTHERS : APPLICANTS</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="versus">VERSUS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#versus" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

KATMAI INVESTMENTS LTD : 2nd RESPONDENT
CALUWA LIMITED : 3rd RESPONDENT
GIAN CARLO FERRARI : 4th RESPONDENT</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="supporting-affidavit">SUPPORTING AFFIDAVIT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#supporting-affidavit" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>I, YUVINALIS ANGIMA, a resident of Nairobi and Post Office Box Number 55645-00200 Nairobi in the Republic of Kenya hereby solemnly affirm and state as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT I am an advocate of this honourable court practising as such in the firm of Rachier &amp; Amollo Advocates who are on record in this matter on behalf of the applicants.</li>
<li>THAT I have the conduct of this matter on behalf of the applicants, fully conversant with the facts and circumstances of the case, and I have their authority to affirm this affidavit on their behalf.</li>
<li>THAT I am aware that the applicants herein filed an application for recognition and enforcement of an Arbitral Award on 21st June 2004 vide a Notice of Motion of even date.</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ol start="4">
<li>
<p>THAT the said application was fixed for hearing in the first instance on 20th September 2004 when it was not listed at all due to a mistake on the part of the court registry.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT subsequently, this matter was fixed for hearing on 15th January 2005 when again the matter was not listed.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT on 19th January 2005 the applicants moved this honourable court under certificate of urgency for an early hearing date for the said application dated 21st June 2004 whereupon the court fixed the same for hearing on 3rd March 2005.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT, however, the applicants' advocate inadvertently and erroneously recorded the hearing date as 23rd March 2005 and proceeded to serve a hearing notice upon the respondents for the said date. The said advocates also wrote to the applicants informing them of the said date. (Annexed hereto and marked "YA" are copies of the relevant office diary, hearing notice and relevant letter to the applicants).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the applicants' advocates did not discover the said mistake until 3rd March 2005 when this matter was listed before the Hon. Justice Kubo who insisted that it is the Respondents' Notice of Motion dated 23rd August 2004 which had been mistakenly listed for hearing before the due date.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT in any event, the matter could not have proceed on that day because of the mistake on the part of the applicants' advocates stated in paragraph 7 hereof.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT this matter is still urgent and should be heard on a priority basis because the circumstances stated in the affidavit of Giovanni Gaida filed herein on 19th January 2005 still prevail to date.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I am informed by the said Giovanni Gaida, which information I hold to be true, that the Respondents to date continue to wilfully disobey the Arbitral Award in the following manner:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>(i) The Respondents have in fact by way of a letter and in a manner contrary to the Arbitral Award threatened to sell off the whole complex known as the Karibuni Villas.</p>
<p>(ii) The Respondents have issued Notice of payment of management fees to many of the claimants which notice contains computations not in compliance with the Arbitral Award.</p>
<p>(iii) The Respondents have neglected, failed and or refused to provide the applicants with basic utilities and amenities including water, etc in the complex contrary to the arbitral award thus making life at the complex difficult.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>(iv) The Respondents have further infringed on the applicants' right to the parking area by not only embarking on construction works on the same but also refusing that the applicants park therein.</p>
<p>(v) The Respondents have restrained the free movement of the applicants in and out of the complex by inter alia placing a chain at the main entrance in a manner contrary to the lease Agreement.</p>
<p>(vi) The Respondents have built garages in the common area thus hindering the applicants from making use of the utilities in the common areas which are essentially to be used by all the applicants.</p>
<p>(vii) The Respondents have failed to cut grass in the gardens despite provision of clause 3 (b) of the Lease document.</p>
<p>(viii) The Respondents have refused to allow the applicants to use trolleys and porters at reception, and also refused to avail them wake up calls, and also the use of other services at the reception.</p>
<ol start="12">
<li>
<p>THAT in the circumstances, it would be in the interest of justice to have this matter disposed of expeditiously and in that regard I would urge this honourable court to grant an early hearing date for the said application.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the Respondents' Notice of Motion dated 23rd August 2004 is already fixed for hearing on 13th April 2005 and I would pray that the Applicants' Notice of Motion dated 21st June 2004 be heard on the same date since the two applications are inextricably intertwined.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT what is affirmed herein is true to the best of my knowledge save where the same is based upon information whose sources I have expressly disclosed.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>AFFIRMED by the said
YUVINALIS ANGIMA at Nairobi
This ______ day of ______ 2005</p>
<p>BEFORE ME</p>
<p>COMMISSIONER FOR OATHS</p>

RACHIER &amp; AMOLLO</p>

MISCELLANEOUS APPLICATION NO. OF 2010</p>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF:
THE JUDICATURE ACT CAP 8 LAWS OF KENYA, SECTION 63(C), (E) AND SECTION 3A OF THE CIVIL PROCEDURE ACT, ORDER XXXIX RULE 2A (2) OF CIVIL PROCEDURE RULES, AND SECTION 17 OF THE MARRIED WOMEN'S PROPERTY ACT OF 1882.</p>

<p>TAKE NOTICE that the Applicant herein, Ruth Monica Wanjiku Kiguru will move this Honourable court for leave to institute contempt of court proceedings against the Respondent herein for disobeying this Honourable court's orders of 11th December 2007 in High Court Civil Case No. 20 of 2005, Nairobi.</p>

<p>IN THE MATTER OF:

<p>NOTICE OF MOTION</p>
<p>(Under Section 5(1) of the Judicature Act Cap 8 Laws of Kenya, Section 63(c), (e) and Section
3A of the Civil Procedure Act, Order xxxix rule 2A (2) of the Civil Procedure Rules, and Section
17 of the Married Women's Property Act of 1882)</p>
<p>Ex Parte:</p>
<p>TAKE NOTICE that this Honourable Court will be moved on the ... day of
... 2009 at 9.00 o'clock in the forenoon or so soon thereafter for the hearing of the
Applicant's application for ORDERS:</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT leave be granted to Applicant to apply for an order of committal for contempt of
court by the respondent herein.</li>
<li>THAT all necessary and consequential directions be given.</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>THAT costs of this application be in the cause.</li>
</ol>
<p>WHICH APPLICATION is based on the following grounds and on the annexed affidavit of Ruth Monica Wanjiru Kiguru.</p>
<p>(a) On the 11th December 2007, the Hon. Lady Justice (Mrs.) R. Nambuye in High Court civil case No. 20 of 2005 made orders restraining the respondent herein from wasting, selling, damaging, or in anyway alienating the matrimonial property listed in the said court order.
(b) The court made orders against the respondent compelling him to release to the applicant the control of L.R 4953/1434 who henceforth was to collect rents or alternatively reside therein.
(c) The court made orders compelling the respondent within 60 days to prepare and file in court all accounts for all the rents collected from family properties from the date of the couple's separation until 30th of June 2007.
(d) The court also made orders compelling the respondent to tender a report to court on the status of all loans touching on family properties, if any, showing outstanding loans and/instalments, within a period of 30 days.
(e) That notwithstanding the service of the said order of 11th December 2007 together with a penal notice, the respondent has blatantly and in total disregard of the said order failed to comply.
(f) It is essential for the rule of law and administration of justice that court orders are obeyed.
(g) It is imperative for the court to commit the contemnors to jail to compel obedience of the said court orders.
(h) Unless the orders prayed for are granted, the court orders made shall be rendered nugatory and the applicant shall be prejudiced.
(i) It is in the interest of justice that the orders prayed are granted.</p>
<p>Dated at Nairobi this day of 2010.</p>
<p>Muri Mwaniki &amp; Wamiti,
Advocates for the Applicant.</p>
<p>DRAWN &amp; FILED BY:
Muri Mwaniki &amp; Wamiti,
Advocates,
Rehani Hse, 10th Floor,
Kenyatta Avenue/Koinange Street,
P.O Box 13726-00100,
Nairobi.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="in-the-high-court-of-kenya-at-nairobi">IN THE HIGH COURT OF KENYA AT NAIROBI<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#in-the-high-court-of-kenya-at-nairobi" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h4 level="4" id="miscellaneous-application-no-of-2010">MISCELLANEOUS APPLICATION NO. OF 2010<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#miscellaneous-application-no-of-2010" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h4></div>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF:
THE JUDICATURE ACT CAP 8 LAWS OF KENYA, SECTION 63(C), (E) AND SECTION 3A OF THE CIVIL PROCEDURE ACT, ORDER XXXIX RULE 2A (2) OF CIVIL PROCEDURE RULES, AND SECTION 17 OF THE MARRIED WOMEN'S PROPERTY ACT OF 1882.</p>
<p>IN THE MATTER OF:
ORDERS MADE BY THIS HONOURABLE COURT ON THE 11TH DAY OF DECEMBER 2007 IN HIGH COURT CIVIL CASE NO. 20 OF 2005, NAIROBI DIRECTED TO THE RESPONDENT HEREIN.</p>
<p>RUTH MONICA WANJIKU
KIGURU
APPLICANT.
AND
ALEX KIGURU
NG'ANG'A
RESPONDENT.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="supporting-affidavit">SUPPORTING AFFIDAVIT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#supporting-affidavit" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>I, RUTH MONICA WANJIKU KIGURU of P.O Box number 2446 Thika in the Republic of Kenya do hereby make oath and state as follows;</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT I am the applicant herein, conversant with the facts pertaining this matter hence competent to swear this affidavit.</li>
<li>THAT I am the wife to the respondent herein having got married on the 4th March 1978 at Anglican Church at Thare and we were issued with marriage certificate number 348924, (Annexure RMWK-I - certified copy of an entry of marriage).</li>
<li>THAT we established our matrimonial home at section 9 in Thika and we were blessed with three issues namely;
(a) Anthony Ng'ang'a Kiguru...Born on 01/05/1978.
(b) Jackline Njeri Kiguru...Born on 19/11/1980.
(c) Bedan Kiguru Njoroge...Born on 18.08/1983.</li>
<li>THAT sometime in the period between 11/6/1979 and 4/6/1989, I was employed as a secretary where I rose to become the secretary to the managing director at Yuken Textile Industry Limited.</li>
<li>THAT through my income and other indirect contributions, I contributed towards the purchase of matrimonial property to wit;
(a) Kakuzi Kirimiri/Block 9/13.
(b) Kakuzi Kirimiri/Block 9/8.
(c) Kakuzi Kirimiri/Block 9/12.</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>(d) Kakuzi Kirimiri/Block9/14.
(e) L.R No 4953/1435.
(f) Makongeni residential Plot No. SSS 13/252.
(g) Makongeni residential Plot No. SSS 13/114.
(h) Location 4/ Nguthuru/18.
(i) Location 4/ Nguthuru/13.
(j) Location 4/Nguthuru/741.
(k) Location 4/Nguthuru/221.
(l) Location 4/Nguthuru/1468.
(m) Shares in Athena Investment.
(n) Shares in Kandara Investment.
(o) Shares in Nyaga Consultancy.
(p) Motor vehicles registration numbers KAN 304 J, KAD 954 Y, KAC 976 B, KAN 359 R, KAG 460 M, KAE 346 W, KAC 919 N and KAC 469 D.
(q) Two sofa sets, 4 coffee tables, 1 dinning table with 7 chairs, 2 wall units, 4 carpets, 2 colour T.V sets, 1 video player, 2 refrigerators, 1 gas cooker, 1 gas cylinder, 6 beds, 3 wardrobes, 1 chest of drawers, 2 dressing tables and 1 music system.</p>
<ol start="6">
<li>
<p>THAT sometime in June 2000, the respondent chased me from the matrimonial home and moved in with another woman by the names Agnes Mueni, with whom they have born 3 children.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT since then the respondent has disposed off, transferred and/or sold the following properties;
(a) Thika Municipality Block 1/47 evidenced by annexure RMWK-II (copy of sale agreement dated 24th December 2002).
(b) Makongeni residential Plot No. SSS 6/36.
(c) Motor vehicles registration numbers KAL 974 L, KAB 833 P, KAP 584 Z, KAM 492 Y, KAD 277 C, KAC 076 F, and KAB 9231 V.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the respondent after kicking me out of the matrimonial home, continues to deny me the use and enjoyment of rental income received from property L.R No 4953/1434 which I own.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT further, the respondent failed to service a loan which is secured by the aforementioned property L.R No 4953/1434 rendering it liable to for sale by the chargee, Barclays Bank of Kenya Limited. The outstanding amount as at May 2006 was around Kshs. 395,000/-. Annexure RMWK-III (copy of the title document showing the charge).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I visited the offices of Muri Mwaniki &amp; Wamiti Advocates and expressed my fears to them and after consultations, instructed them to move to court to protect my interest and that of my children.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT on the 29th of July 2006, my Advocates on record filed an application by way of chamber summons in High Court civil case number 20 of 2005 seeking the following orders against the respondent herein;
(a) Restraining orders against the respondent by himself, his servants, agents, and/or employees from wasting, damaging, alienating, or in anyway transferring the matrimonial property listed in paragraph 5 above pending the hearing and determination of the application.
(b) Restraining orders against the respondent either by himself, his employees, servants and/or agents or otherwise from dealing with property L.R No 4953/1434,</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>including being restrained from receiving and/or collecting rent or in any manner blocking the applicant from collecting rent derived from the property pending the hearing and determination of the application.</p>
<p>(c) That the respondent do account for all the income he received from L.R No 4953/1434.</p>
<p>(d) That the respondent be ordered to pay the outstanding arrears arising from, and generally service the loan secured by L.R No 4953/1434 pending the hearing and determination of the application until payment in full.</p>
<ol start="12">
<li>
<p>THAT I aver that the said application was heard on the 7th June 2007 and ruling reserved for the 26th July 2007 but it was not delivered until the 11th of October 2007.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT on the said 11th October 2007, the ruling was delivered by the Hon. Lady Justice (Mrs.) R. Nambuye and prayers sought were granted in the following terms. (Annexure RMWK-IV (copy of the Court Order and the Penal Notice).</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>(a) Restraining orders as prayed in paragraph 2 a-q of the applicant’s chamber summons application were granted as prayed.</p>
<p>(b) The respondent was ordered to release to me (the applicant) the control of L.R No 4953/1434 and I was to collect rent or alternatively reside there until the suit is heard and determined.</p>
<p>(c) The respondent was ordered to prepare and file in court all accounts for all rents collected from family properties from the date of our separation until 30th June 2007.</p>
<p>(d) That the respondent was ordered to tender a report to court on the status of all loans touching the family properties, if any, showing the outstanding loans and/or instalments within a period of 30 days.</p>
<ol start="14">
<li>
<p>THAT I am informed by my Advocates on record, which information I verily believe to be true, that a certified copy of the order issued on the 21st December 2007 together with the penal notice were personally served upon the respondent herein. (Annexure RMWK V-copy of the Affidavit of Service).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I aver that notwithstanding the service of the said order upon the respondent, he has blatantly disobeyed the same by;</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>(a) Failing to release property L.R 4953/1434 to my control the (applicant herein), and/or allow me to collect rent there from.</p>
<p>(b) The respondent has failed to file in court an account of all rents collected from family properties from the date of separation until 30th June 2007.</p>
<p>(c) The respondent has failed to tender to court a report on the status of all loans touching on the family properties, if any, showing the outstanding and/or instalments within a period of 30 days.</p>
<ol start="16">
<li>
<p>THAT as a result of the respondent’s continued disobedience of the court order; I continue to suffer a lot since I have children to support. I currently rely on relative’s assistance, in particular my father.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I am advised by my Advocate on record, Mr. Njuguna Muri, which information I verily believe to be true that;</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>(a) The order issued on the 21st December 2007 was served upon the respondent and he should therefore be cited for contempt for deliberately acting in breach of the said order.</p>
<p>(b) It is essential for the rule of law and administration of justice that court orders be obeyed.</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>(c) It is just for the court to commit the contemnors to jail to compel compliance of court orders.
(d) That unless leave for contempt proceedings is allowed and the contemnors compelled to obey the court orders, I stand to suffer prejudice and irreparable loss and damage.</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>THAT I verily believe that it is just and proper that leave be granted for application for an order of committal for contempt of court against the respondent herein to compel him to obey court orders issued on 21st December 2007.</li>
<li>THAT I swear this affidavit in support of my application for leave to cite the respondent for contempt of court.</li>
<li>THAT what is deposed to herein is true to the best of my knowledge, save for matters deposed to on information and belief sources whereof have been disclosed.</li>
</ol>
<p>Sworn by the said RUTH MONICA
WANJIRU KIGURU</p>
<p>At Nairobi this day of 2010.</p>
<p>BEFORE ME:</p>
<p>COMMISSIONER FOR OATHS</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="chamber-summons">CHAMBER SUMMONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#chamber-summons" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Applications by way of Chamber Summons are used when seeking orders within a pending suit.</li>
<li>The Application must always be brought and sought under a specific rule. Chamber Summons was historically heard in chambers thus the name Chamber Summons.</li>
<li>Look at the general rules relating to Notice of Motion and Chamber Summons. These applications are normally requested for certain orders and the courts will not usually grant ex parte orders unless it has heard both sides. Service is of the essence.</li>
<li>If it is an urgent matter and irreparable harm will be occasioned, the court can grant the Order Ex Parte after hearing one side. An ex parte order is only granted upon the undertaking by that party that they shall file the substantive suit and/or serve the other side within a period specified by the Court.</li>
<li>Every summons shall state in general terms the grounds of the Application usually supported by evidence in an affidavit. Application is heard in Chambers and may be transferred to open court or vice versa as the judge may deem convenient.</li>
<li>In the case where an applicant is being heard in chambers the public shall be allowed to be present.</li>
<li>Where the Application has been made, the Respondent should file and serve the Applicant with an Affidavit and a statement of the grounds upon which he will oppose the application.</li>
</ul>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="chamber-summons">CHAMBER SUMMONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#chamber-summons" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>(Under Rules 3(3) and 36 of the Matrimonial Causes Rules)</p>
<p><strong>LET ALL PARTIES CONCERNED</strong> attend the Honourable Judge in chambers on the ______ day of ______ 2006 at 9.00 O'clock in the forenoon or soon thereafter as the Honourable Court may be pleased to direct on the hearing of an application by the Petitioner/ Applicant for ORDERS:</p>
<ol>
<li>THAT this Honourable court be pleased to grant leave to the Petitioner/Applicant to file Notice of Application for Decree Nisi to be made Absolute out of time.</li>
<li>THAT the draft Notice of Application for Decree Nisi to be made Absolute exhibited on the affidavit of JASON NGUMBA KAGU sworn in support hereof be deemed to be duly filed upon payment of the requisite filing fees.</li>
<li>THAT the costs of this application be costs in the cause.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>WHICH APPLICATION</strong> is brought on the grounds that:</p>
<ol>
<li>The applicant desires that the decree nisi be made absolute.</li>
<li>The decree nisi was issued on 3rd June 2005 and it is over one year since the decree nisi was issued.</li>
<li>It is a requirement of law that leave of this Honourable Court must first be sought and obtained before the requisite notice can be filed.</li>
</ol>
<p>AND is further supported by the annexed affidavit of JASON NGUMBA KAGU and on such other and/or further grounds as may be canvassed at the hearing hereof.</p>
<p>DATED at Nairobi this ______ day of August 2006</p>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="republic-of-kenya">REPUBLIC OF KENYA<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#republic-of-kenya" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h5 level="5" id="divorce-cause-no-38-of-2004">DIVORCE CAUSE NO. 38 OF 2004<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#divorce-cause-no-38-of-2004" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h5></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="affidavit">AFFIDAVIT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#affidavit" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>I, JASON NGUMBA KAGO of Post office Box Number 56078 Nairobi within the Republic of Kenya do hereby take oath and state as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p>THAT I am the Petitioner/Applicant herein fully conversant with the facts of this matter and I am therefore competent to swear this affidavit.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the decree-nisi herein was issued on 3rd June 2005 and that it is over one year today ever since the decree-nisi was issued.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT it is my desire that the decree-nisi be made absolute and I have instructed my advocates to issue the requisite notice.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I am advised by Paul Mungla Advocate, which advice I verily believe to be correct that leave of this Honourable Court is now needed before the notice of application for Decree-Nisi to be made Absolute can be filed in court.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT the delay has been occasioned by the fact that I have been out of town and I could therefore not reach my Advocates in good time to give them instructions to file the notice. That the delay is thus excusable and not prejudicial to the respondent.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>THAT I swear this affidavit in support of my application for leave to file the notice out of time. Exhibited hereon and marked JN-1 is the draft notice.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>SWORN by the said JASON NGUMBA KAGO
at Nairobi this day of 2006 ) DEPONENT</p>
<p>BEFORE ME</p>

<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="petitions">PETITIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#petitions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>They are on the whole very few and are getting rarer. It is not a common way of instituting proceedings.</li>
<li>They can only be adopted where there are express provisions for the use of petitions indicated by statute. It is an application in the nature of proceedings stating a party's case.</li>
<li>It is made in open court.</li>
<li>Examples:
a) Presidential, parliamentary and civil disputes
b) Matrimonial causes proceedings.
c) Companies winding up
d) Bankruptcy
e) Constitutional Litigation – Civil litigation seeking to have a constitutional right enforced/answered.</li>
<li>In general there are no prescribed forms. The titles in some of them are like OS and NOM (In the matter ...). Petitions are usually accompanied by affidavit setting out the facts.</li>
<li>Look at the Constitution of Kenya (Supervisory Jurisdiction and Protection of Fundamental Rights and Freedoms of the Individual) High Court Practice &amp; Procedure Rules 2006.</li>
<li>The general rule is that an advocate should not swear an affidavit on behalf of his client. What is your role an advocate or witness? Never trust your client 100%.</li>
<li>In the petition set a logical sequence of how the matter arises like a plaint. Concludes with prayers stating ...and your petitioner will ever pray? The person instituting the petition is called a petitioner and the other party is called a respondent.</li>
<li>The petitioner must be served just like a plaint. (See Order 5).</li>
<li>Where certain rules prescribe special rules of service e.g. presidential or parliamentary service must be adopted.</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="a-election-petitions">a) ELECTION PETITIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-election-petitions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ul>
<li>Election matters questions.
(i) Whether a person has been validly elected as a president?</li>
</ul>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>(ii) Whether a person has been validly elected as a Member of Parliament?
(iii) Whether a seat of the national assembly has become vacant?</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="grounds">Grounds<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#grounds" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>a) Whether there was a corrupt practice in the election process e.g. impersonation, undue influence or bribery.
b) Lack of a majority of lawfully votes
c) Substantial non-compliance of the election regulations</p>
<ul>
<li>Forms of petitions is prescribed in the rules. Elections Act No. 24 of 2011</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="b-matrimonial-causes-act">b) MATRIMONIAL CAUSES ACT<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#b-matrimonial-causes-act" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>In matrimonial causes you adopt a petition as the only process by which you can seek relief from the court.</li>
<li>This should be addressed to the court with the right jurisdiction.</li>
<li>State the grounds on which you seek divorce or judicial separation.</li>
</ul>
<p>a) Adultery
b) Cruelty
c) Desertion</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="c-winding-up-petitions">c) WINDING UP PETITIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#c-winding-up-petitions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The Companies Act Part 6 s218, the High Court has jurisdiction to wind up companies.</li>
<li>Circumstances for winding up are set up in section 219 as grounds in which a company can be set out?</li>
<li>Section 221 applications shall be by a petition and sets out the right parties i.e. creditors, the company, the official receiver if the company is being wound up voluntarily.</li>
<li>The company winding up rules deal with details on how the process takes place. The winding up application takes a prescribed Form No.3, 4 and 5.</li>
<li>This could be varied through.</li>
</ul>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>
<p>d) IN THE MATTER OF THE COMPANIES ACT</p>
<ul>
<li>This is presented before the High Court Registrar and upon presentation, the petitioner must deposit to the Official Receiver a prescribed fee and any such sum that the court may from time to time direct.</li>
<li>No petition shall be received until you produce a receipt before the Registrar. The petition must be advertised and serve the Company- Rule 23 and 24, at the registered office or principal place of business.</li>
<li>If you cannot find them then seek directions from court and an affidavit of service should be sworn.</li>
<li>The verification clause to verify the petition sworn by the petitioner or where it is a corporation it should be sworn by the Legal Officer or Managing Director. The affidavit is in Form No. 11. Every creditor shall be entitled to be furnished with a copy of the petition. Rule 26.</li>
</ul>
<p>THESE NOTES HAVE BEEN COMPILED BY JOSEPH MCDONALD.</p>
<p>ATP 100-CIVIL LITIGATION</p>

Annexed herewith and marked Exhibit "A" is a copy of the marriage certificate.</li>

a) Lang'ata – 2004 June to September 2004.
b) Respondent went to Nigeria in September 2004. Parties lived in Nigeria until October 2005 when Petitioner came back to deliver their second born baby.
c) November 2005 – January 2006 lived at Muringa Court, in Kilimani
